CatDescriptText: Augie Merlina, Taxicab Driver, 1121 Hunter Street, Wilkinsburg, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe Negroes, who get public assistance, do more cheating than whites?" answer reads: "I wouldn't know. Truthfully, I can't say."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Augie Merlina wearing Yellow Cab uniform cap standing in front of May Building with Thrift Drugs, with taxicab parked on right, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
